exercise.title: Unix Survey
exercise.name: unix_survey
exercise.shortdescription: Simple survey to enumerate a Linux host.
exercise.description: Simple survey to enumerate a Linux host.
exercise.tutorial:
Open up a workstation and utilize putty to ssh into Kali box.  Run the following surevy commands and interpret their output.  Use "man [command]" for more information or research online.  The post exercise questions will need to be answered based on results from the survey.

 

"id" - Print user and group IDs

"w" - Display who's logged in

"pwd" - Print current working directory

"ls -alrt" - List all files sorted in reverse time order

"ls -alrt /" - List files in root directory

"ls -alrt /tmp" - List files in /tmp

"ls -alrt /var" - List files in /var

"ls -alrt /var/log" - List files in /var/log

"dmesg" - Display the kernel log buffer

"ps -ef --sort start_time" - Dispaly all processes sorted in reverse time order

"netstat -antup" - Display all TCP and UDP network sockets with their associated process

"netstat -antup | grep EST" - Display established connections

"netstat -antup | grep LIST" - Display listening connections

"df -h" - Display filesystems with "human readable" storage sizes

"cat /proc/cpuinfo" - Display CPU information

"cat /proc/meminfo" - Display memory information

 "uname -a" - Shows kernel build information

 "ls -al /home/*/.*history" - Show user shell history files

"ls -al /root/.*history" - Show root's shell history file

question.text: Which of the following is *not* in the output of 'w'?
What are your user and group IDs?
Which log message type appears in /var/log/secure?
What time zone is the machine configured for?
What is the model of the CPU?
